gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 10,1]]The Lord Jesus appointed seventy-two others whom he sent ahead of him in pairs to every town and place he intended to visit.
[[Lc 10,2]]He said to them, "The harvest is abundant but the laborers are few; so ask the master of the harvest to send out laborers for his harvest.
[[Lc 10,3]]Go on your way; behold, I am sending you like lambs among wolves.
[[Lc 10,4]]Carry no money bag, no sack, no sandals; and greet no one along the way.
[[Lc 10,5]]Into whatever house you enter, first say, 'Peace to this household.'
[[Lc 10,6]]If a peaceful person lives there, your peace will rest on him; but if not, it will return to you.
[[Lc 10,7]]Stay in the same house and eat and drink what is offered to you, for the laborer deserves his payment. Do not move about from one house to another.
[[Lc 10,8]]Whatever town you enter and they welcome you, eat what is set before you,
[[Lc 10,9]]cure the sick in it and say to them, 'The kingdom of God is at hand for you.'"

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 145,10]]Let all your works give you thanks, O LORD,
and let your faithful ones bless you.
[[Ps 145,11]]Let them discourse of the glory of your Kingdom 
and speak of your might.

[[Ps 145,12]]Making known to men your might 
and the glorious splendor of your Kingdom.
[[Ps 145,13a]]Your Kingdom is a Kingdom for all ages,
[[Ps 145,13b]]and your dominion endures through all generations.

[[Ps 145,17]]The LORD is just in all his ways 
and holy in all his works.
[[Ps 145,18]]The LORD is near to all who call upon him, 
to all who call upon him in truth.

first_reading.title: Second Letter to Timothy
first_reading.text:
[[2_Tm 4,10]]Beloved: Demas, enamored of the present world, deserted me and went to Thessalonica, Crescens to Galatia, and Titus to Dalmatia.
[[2_Tm 4,11]]Luke is the only one with me. Get Mark and bring him with you, for he is helpful to me in the ministry.
[[2_Tm 4,12]]I have sent Tychicus to Ephesus.
[[2_Tm 4,13]]When you come, bring the cloak I left with Carpus in Troas, the papyrus rolls, and especially the parchments.
[[2_Tm 4,14]]Alexander the coppersmith did me a great deal of harm; the Lord will repay him according to his deeds.
[[2_Tm 4,15]]You too be on guard against him, for he has strongly resisted our preaching.
[[2_Tm 4,16]]At my first defense no one appeared on my behalf, but everyone deserted me. May it not be held against them!
[[2_Tm 4,17b]]But the Lord stood by me and gave me strength, so that through me the proclamation might be completed and all the Gentiles might hear it.
